meta.description: WorldCereal maize, globally, at 10m resolution in specific seasons throughout the year.
WorldCereal spring cereals, globally, at 10m resolution in specific seasons throughout the year.

Pixel-based, binary classification product at 10m spatial resolution distinguishing annual cropland from all other types of land cover. Annual cropland is defined according to the JECAM 2018 definition, in short: A piece of land that is sowed/planted and harvestable at least once within the 12 months after the sowing/planting date. The annual cropland produces an herbaceous cover which should reach a coverage of 30% and can be combined with some tree or woody vegetation not exceeding a coverage of 20%. Exception 1: Sugarcane and cassava, although perennial crops, are explicitly included. Exception 2: Frequently harvested, annual and/or perennial fodder crops such as grasslands and alfalfa are explicitly excluded. Exception 3: Greenhouse crops are excluded. This product is generated within one month after the end of the main growing season and looks back one year in time.
WorldCereal winter cereals, globally, at 10m resolution in specific seasons throughout the year.
